conclusion: Initial equilibrium state with object C having mass m.
Gravitational force on object A is 2mg.
Tension in the rope is mg, balancing the weight of object C.
Initial spring force is mg, balancing the difference in forces.
Gravitational force on object B is 3mg.
Spring force and B's weight balance out, so B doesn't move.
New equilibrium state with object C having mass 5m.
New tension in the rope is 5mg, balancing the weight of the new C.
New spring force is 2mg, balancing the forces on A.
Object B remains on the ground, so it doesn't move.
Initial compression x1 is mg/k from the initial spring force.
New compression x2 is 2mg/k from the new spring force.
Actual upward movement of A is 4mg/k.
The height that object A rises during this process is 4mg/k.
